_header: First as the earth increaseth populace
Title(s): The Origin and Description of Heraldry
_description: The Origin and Description of Heraldry — thirty-six rhyme royal stanzas

OxfQueens161.First Lines:
ffirst as þe erth incresith populusSo convalit vicis and
                    variance…
OxfQueens161.Last Lines:
…My said lordis correct me deligentTo maidmenis or sey ye
                    remanent
OxfQueens161.Editions:
Bowers,  Robert Hood. 
             “The Middle Scotch Poem on Heraldry in Queen’s College MS
                161.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         51 (1936): 429-31: 429-31.

BLHar6149.First Lines:
FIrst as þe erth incresith populusSo convalit vicit &
                    variance…
BLHar6149.Last Lines:
…My said lordis correk me diligentTo maid menis or sey þe
                    remanent
BLHar6149.Note:
Preceded by six folios of heraldic illustrations (ff.
                        145v-150v).
BLHar6149.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Queene Elizabethes Achademy, etc.
